Name: Debt or Bonds, Relocating Business
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York in relation to prohibiting the city from incurring any debt or circulating or authorizing any bonds with the purpose or effect of relocating any enterprise, business or similar activity from an economically challenged neighborhood in the city of New York.
Text:
Be it enacted by the Council as follows:

    	Section 1.  Chapter one of title five of the administrative code of the city of New York is hereby amended by adding a new section 5-108 to read as follows:
    	    	�5-108.  Restriction on incurring debt for projects that relocate existing business activities from an economically challenged neighborhood.  1.  Definitions.  For the purposes of this section, "economically challenged neighborhood" shall mean a geographic area with a population of not less than two thousand persons, which, based upon census tract data currently available, constitutes a single census tract or group of census tracts possessing the following statistical profile in the year to which such census data apply:
    	    	    	a.  a poverty rate of not less than twenty percent (20%) or a public assistance rate of not less than twenty percent (20%), of the total population; and
    	    	    	b.  an unemployment rate of not less than one hundred twenty five percent (125%) of the statewide unemployment rate.
    	In addition, a census tract shall be deemed to be economically challenged if it is contiguous to a census tract which meets the foregoing criteria.
    	    	2.  The city shall not incur any indebtedness nor authorize or circulate any bonds whenever the purpose or effect of such underlying proposed capital expenditure would be to assist or facilitate the relocation of any enterprise, business or similar activity from an economically challenged neighborhood in the city of New York.
    	�2.  This local law shall take effect immediately.

    	Referred to the Committee on Econmic Development.
